Dear Mr. Lheureux:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/18/23, staff member took youth to the library. Youth
became frustrated and went into the bathroom for some space.
When youth exited, the staff member was gone and had left the
youth at the library. The staff member returned to the library with
law enforcement to look for the youth. The youth was left
unattended for 10-15 minutes. Staff reported youth as AWOL.
When they returned back to the facility, youth was locked out of
the building for a brief moment before being let in.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint Source was interviewed via phone on December 21,
2023. Complaint Source reported her role at the facility is to investigate
client rights concerns and these allegations were brought to her
attention. She reported Youth A reported to her she got into an
argument with Staff 1 at the library and she went into the restroom to get
some space. Youth A reported when she got back, Staff 1 had left her at
the library. Youth A reported Staff 1 did come back to get her about
fifteen minutes later and when they got back to campus, Staff 1 told
Youth A she was not putting up with this today and walked to the gym
area. Youth A was unable to get back into the building. Complaint
Source reported Staff 2 saw this situation occur and Program Manager
was the one to let Youth A into the building. Complaint Source reported
Youth B was on the outing with Staff 1 and Youth A at the library. She
reported she spoke with Youth B who reported Staff 1 did not look for
Youth A and just brought Youth B back to the facility first. Youth B
reported she did not hear Youth A say she was going to the restroom.
Complaint Source reported Staff 1 has been put on administrative leave
pending this investigation.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on December
27, 2023. Youth A reported on December 18, 2023, she went to the
library with Youth B and Staff 1. She reported she and Youth B went to
go play on the computers and Staff 1 started to argue with her about
where she was sitting. Youth A reported she knows the rules are that
staff need to be able to see their computer screens and there was a spot
where Staff 1 could sit to view both screens, but Staff 1 did not want to
sit there. Youth A reported Staff 1 told her, “If you don’t move, I will
make sure your Christmas is ruined.” She reported this made her upset
and ended up talking to Supervisor 1 on the phone. Youth A reported
when she talked to Supervisor 1, she told her that she could come back
to the facility if she wanted. She reported she told Staff 1 that she was
2

going to go to the bathroom to get some space and walked through the
double doors to the bathroom at the library. Youth A reported she went
to the bathroom for about 15-20 minutes and when she came out Staff 1
and Youth B were gone from the library. She reported she looked
outside and saw that the facility van was gone. Youth A reported after
about ten minutes she called Foster Care Worker because she was left
alone at the library. She reported she then looked outside and saw a
police officer who was talking with Staff 1. Youth A reported she went
outside, and the police officer asked her to get into the car with Staff 1.
She reported she did not feel safe going with Staff 1, but the police
officer told her if she did not go with Staff 1, she would end up going to
detention. Youth A reported she got into the car with Staff 1 and at this
time Youth B was not present. She reported when she got back to the
facility, Staff 1 got out of the car and headed towards the gym. Youth A
reported that she was having breathing issues and Staff 1 did not wait
up for her. She reported Staff 1 just went into the gym while Youth A
stayed outside. She reported Staff 2 found her outside and gave her
comfort. Youth A reported Program Manager walked by, and she was
brought back into the unit with him. She reported she does not
remember what Staff 1 said to her when she got back to the facility in
the car. Youth A reported she does remember telling Staff 1 that she
was going to the bathroom and reported that staff are always supposed
to keep an eye on the youth when they are on an outing.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January 4,
2024. Staff 1 reported on December 18, 2023, she was working with
three other staff members. She stated Youth A had recently got off her
one-on-one status and was allowed to go on outings with others. Staff 1
reported she took Youth A and Youth B to the public library and asked if
any other staff members wanted to go but everyone else declined. She
reported when she went to the library, all three of them walked into the
library area through both sets of doors. Staff 1 reported she went to the
customer service area to get the book she had on hold, while Youth A
took a seat at the computers and Youth B went to the bathroom. She
reported she was able to have eyes on both areas the youth were in.
Staff 1 reported she got her book and Youth A and Youth B were sitting
at the computer in the middle of the computer area. She reported she
asked the youth to move down to the end of the computer area so she
could have a better view of the screens. Staff 1 reported she saw Youth
A had the cord for her mp3 player to download music and that was not
allowed. She stated Youth A knew Staff 1 caught her with it and Youth A
refused to move her seat. Staff 1 reported a power struggle began to
happen so she called Supervisor 1 for support. She reported Supervisor
1 told her to set the expectation with Youth A and if she did not follow
she needed to come back to the facility. Staff 1 reported she asked
Supervisor 1 to also explain that to Youth A over the phone, which did
occur. She reported Youth A still refused to sit in the requested seat.
Staff 1 reported Youth A then stood up and stated “I am not going back
to the facility with youth, I am going to walk back.” She reported she saw
Youth A exit the first set of doors out of the library into the lobby area.
Staff 1 reported she did not see Youth A walk out the second set of
3

doors outside the building as she was getting Youth B together to get to
leave. Staff 1 reported while Youth B was giving her headset back to the
librarian, she called Supervisor 1 about the situation. She reported
Supervisor 1 gave her the instructions to bring Youth B back
immediately and to call the police. Staff 1 reported that she did not feel
comfortable with leaving the library with Youth B without Youth A, so she
questioned Supervisor 1 if that was the right thing to do. She reported
Supervisor 1 explained to Staff 1 that they just had a big meeting about
if a youth goes AWOL while on an outing with other youth that the other
youth are to return to the unit so they are not exposed to that trauma.
Staff 1 reported this was the first time hearing of this and never saw any
documentation of this change. She reported she confirmed with
Supervisor 1 that she was going to drive Youth B back to the facility and
would call the police on the way back to the facility. Staff 1 stated
Supervisor 1 confirmed that was the correct plan and she followed this
plan as this was what was directed by her upline management. She
reported she called the police in the car while she drove Youth B back.
Staff 1 reported when she got back to the facility, she dropped off Youth
B and went back to the library to go look more for Youth A. She reported
she was not instructed to do this but felt this was the right thing to do.
Staff 1 reported when she got back to the library police were there and
she started to talk to them, while that was occurring Youth A walked out
of the library asking where she went. Youth A refused to get into the car
with Staff 1 and police gave Youth A the option to go to detention or get
into the car with Staff 1. She reported she never got a police report
number or name of the officer that she spoke with. Youth A got into the
car with Staff 1 and continued to yell at Staff 1 on their way back to the
facility. Staff 1 reported when Youth A got back to the facility, she sat on
the curb outside of the gym building at the facility and refused to walk
back to her unit. Staff 1 reported she saw Staff 2 approaching the area
and let Staff 2 talk with Youth A. She reported she then went into the
gym to see if there was any staff in there for support but there was not.
Staff 1 reported she called Supervisor 1 who reported she was going to
call for staff support. She reported that she never talked with Staff 2
about what she was doing because she did not want to heighten Youth
A behaviors again. Staff 1 reported Program Manager then came over to
help with assistance. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 1 never offered any
support of coming to the library to help support the situation or coming
outside when Youth A arrived back. She reported she did not receive a
police report number or name of the officer because it was just a quick
conversation Youth A had with the police. Staff 1 reported she was
never told to wait for police to get to the library before leaving and was
additament that Supervisor 1 told her to bring Youth B back
immediately. She reported she was doing visual scanning for Youth A at
the library and on the ride back to the facility with Youth B. Staff 1
reported Youth A never told her that she was going to the bathroom, and
she never checked the bathroom before leaving. She reported she just
believed Youth A walked out of the building as she had an incident over
the summer where she AWOL’ed from an outing. Staff 1 reported she
was unaware of the diligent search policy.
4

Youth B was interviewed via phone on December 28, 2023. Youth B
reported she had just recently moved to her grandparent’s home from
the facility. She reported she went on an outing on December 18, 2023,
with Staff 1 and Youth A to the library. Youth B reported Staff 1 and
Youth A began to argue over where Youth A was sitting on the
computer. She reported Youth A got up from the computer and told Staff
1 that she was going to walk back to the facility. Youth B reported she
never heard Youth A say she was going to go to the bathroom. She
reported Youth A had walked away from the area and Staff 1 told Youth
B to pack up her stuff to go back to the facility. Youth B reported Staff 1
took her right to the agency van and never looked around the library for
Youth A. She reported when they were in the agency van driving back to
the facility, Staff 1 called the police to report Youth A AWOL. Youth B
reported she went back to the facility and Staff 1 went back out to the
library. She reported she saw Youth A walk back into the facility with
Program Manager and she was crying.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 27, 2023. Supervisor 1 reported she was working on
December 18, 2023, and was the shift supervisor that day. She reported
Staff 1 took Youth A and Youth B to the library. Supervisor 1 reported
she received a phone call from Staff 1 stating Youth A was getting into a
power struggle with her over where she was sitting at the computer. She
reported she told Staff 1 to give Youth A some space to cool off and
continue to monitor the interactions. Supervisor 1 reported a little bit
later she talked with Youth A on the phone and gave her the option to
come home if she was not going to follow the rules at the library. She
reported about 10-15 minutes later, Staff 1 called her stating that Youth
A would not leave the library, and Supervisor 1 offered to come provide
assistance, but Staff 1 declined that support. She reported Staff 1 then
called again stating, that Youth A had got up and walked away.
Supervisor 1 instructed Staff 1 to go look around everywhere at the
library for Youth A and follow the AWOL protocol. She reported she told
Staff 1 to call the police and when the police arrive, she can bring Youth
B back to the unit. Supervisor 1 reported she met Staff 1 when she
brought Youth B back and Staff 1 went back to the library. She reported
she then received another phone call from Staff 1 stating that she was
back at the facility with Youth A, but she was refusing to come back into
the unit. Supervisor 1 offered to come outside to switch out with Staff 1
for support, but Staff 1 refused. She reported she then called Program
Manager for support with the situation. Supervisor 1 reported she talked
with Youth A when she came back onto the unit because Youth A was
very tearful. She reported Youth A was upset that Staff 1 had just left
her at the library and stated she told Staff 1 she was going to the
bathroom. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A did admit at one point telling
Staff 1 that she was just going to walk back to the facility out of
frustration. She reported if Youth A had told Staff 1 she was going to the
bathroom, Staff 1 should have gone with her to the restroom with Youth
B. Supervisor 1 reported youth should always be in line of sight of staff
when they are out in the community.
5

Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on December 27,
2023. Staff 2 reported she is the occupational therapist for the unit. She
reported on December 18, 2023, that she was bringing a youth back to a
unit. She saw Youth A sitting on the curb crying. Staff 2 reported she
saw Staff 1 walking away and stating to Youth A that she was not going
to deal with this and Youth A was considered AWOL risk. She stated
Staff 1 then walked away and buzzed herself into the gym area leaving
Youth A outside. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 never said anything to Staff 2
but did see her outside. She reported she sat outside with Youth A and
did some breathing techniques with her. Staff 2 reported Youth A
disclosed Staff 1 had left her at the library alone and this made her
upset. She reported Youth A continued to refuse to go inside because
she did not want to be with Staff 1. Program Manager came outside and
during that time Staff 1 came back outside after about 5-10 minutes.
She reported Program Manager was able to get Youth A back inside
and Staff 2 left. Staff 2 reported she did not feel that it was right for Staff
1 to leave Youth A outside and she never communicated to Staff 2 that
she was leaving the area.
Program Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 4, 2024. Program Manager reported on December 18, 2024,
he was getting ready to leave the facility for the day and heard Youth A
yelling outside. He reported at first, he did not see Staff 1 around and
saw Staff 2 talking with Youth A. Program Manager reported that after a
few moments, he saw Staff 1’s head pop out by the gym, and she was
trying to get his attention. He reported his focus was on Youth A and
getting her safely inside the building. Program Manager reported he was
able to get Youth A into her unit after some verbal encouragement. He
stated Staff 1 followed them into the building as well and continued to try
to explain herself to him. Program Manager reported he told Staff 1 she
needed to speak with Supervisor 1 to get the appropriate documentation
completed. He reported he stayed on the unit while Supervisor 1 did a
debrief with Youth A and there were no other concerns noted. Program
Manager was asked if there was a change in policy as it pertains to if a
youth goes AWOL while on an outing that staff needs to bring the other
youth immediately back to the facility and he reported there has been no
change in policy. He reported if the staff and other youth are not in any
present danger or risk, they should follow diligent search efforts and
reach out to on-call for support.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 27, 2023. Supervisor 2 reported he is the home supervisor of
the unit and direct supervisor of Staff 1. He reported he was not working
on December 18, 2023, and just heard of the incident. Supervisor 2
reported there have been some personnel issues with Staff 1 which
resulted in her being demoted from a shift supervisor to a direct care
staff member. He reported the reason for this was Staff 1’s inability to be
a team player and just wanting to do things her own way. Supervisor 2
was asked about policies at the facility, he reported if a youth goes
AWOL during off site outing staff are to wait for police to arrive until
leaving the scene. He also reported if a youth needs to use the restroom
6

while in the community, staff should go to the public restroom with them
and if it is a private restroom they should stand outside the door.
Supervisor 2 reported the overall supervision rule for the unit is for staff
to always have youth in line of sight.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via phone on December 21,
2023. Foster Care Worker is Youth A’s foster care worker and has been
her worker for the past three years. She reported on December 18,
2023, she received a phone call from Youth A, reporting Staff 1 had left
her alone at the library. Foster Care Worker called the facility to see
what was going on and she spoke with Staff 1. She reported Staff 1
stated to her that Youth A had got into a power struggle with her and
Youth A had left the building. Staff 1 reported she was instructed to call
the police and bring Youth B back to the facility. Staff 1 reported she
went back to the library and police encouraged Youth A to get into the
car with Staff 1. Foster Care Worker reported she saw Youth A today
and Youth A confirmed she was out of line of sight from Staff 1 because
she went to the bathroom but she never AWOLed from the facility.
Foster Care Worker reported Youth A was upset as she felt she did not
do anything wrong. She reported Youth A had just got off one-to-one
supervision on December 13, 2023, due to good behavior.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the Kentwood Library occurred on January 4, 2024. When
walking into the Kentwood Public Library main building there is one set
of doors to get into the main lobby. Within the lobby before entering the
next set of doors, into the library, to the right is a hallway that has
restroom areas where there are multiple stalls bathrooms. To enter into
the main library, there are fully glassed doors and windows to enter the
library from the hallway. Once entered into the library there is the main
customer service area next to the computer area. The customer service
area is the reported area Staff 1 first walked up to while Youth A and
Youth B went to the computer area. This is all an open floor plan where
staff could have a full visual of the youth while at the customer service
desk. Behind the computer area near the start of the kid's section is a
single-family restroom area as well.
Documents Reviewed:
- Email from Law Enforcement dated 12/21/2023- Law
Enforcement reported there was no police report completed for
this incident on 12/18/2023. Law Enforcement reported there
was no police report because officers never made contact with
anyone. She reported in the dispatch notes it states that police
were dispatched to the library on a report of Youth A going
AWOL at the library. Staff 1 was the one who called, she told
dispatch she was dropping the other kid back off at the facility
and would return to the library to look for Youth A. Law
Enforcement reported Youth A was found and officers were
disregarded before they made it on scene at the library.
7

- MiSACWIS Incident Report dated 12/18/2023 – This incident
report was completed by Staff 1. This incident report was
constant with Staff 1’s interview.
- Staff 1 Human Resource File and Training Records- Staff 1
has been employed at the facility for over 15 years. Staff 1 has
no disciplinary actions within her human resource file due to
concerns of supervision of the youth. Staff 1 did have written
violations due to failure to complete paperwork promptly, failure
to pass a medication, and lack of harmony in the workplace. On
11/17/2023, Staff 1 was given the notification that she was being
demoted from shift supervisor to direct staff worker due to
concerns of not leading a shift in positive manner. Staff 1 is up to
date on all required trainings.
- Facility Residential Staffing Ratios Procedure most recent
revision date of 07/13/2023- This policy states, “Direct care staff
members are required to maintain line-of-sight supervision of
youths at all times except when youth are in their individual
sleeping rooms or bathrooms.”
- Facility Client Safety Procedures most recent revision date
of 07/13/2023- This policy states, “If clients enter bathrooms that
are used by multiple individuals (e.g., in public settings off
campus), staff members should accompany clients into the
bathroom while maintain the clients’ privacy.”
- Facility Truancy and Missing Persons Procedures most
recent revision date of 07/13/2023- This policy reviews of what
a staff is to do if a youth goes AWOL or threatens AWOL. The
policy notes, “Staff members will make reasonable efforts to
maintain eyes on a client and monitor a client during a truancy
event unless the pursuit places a client or staff members in
danger. Staff members are to continue to verbally encourage the
client to return and cooperate with a transport back to the
program as long as the scene is safe.” It is expected for staff
members to do a diligent search if a youth goes AWOL. This
section stated, “Staff are to make a reasonable effort to search
for a client who has gone AWOL. It is expected that staff
continue “diligent search efforts” for a period of at least one
hour.”
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance of following their diligent
search policy within this situation. Staff 1 did not complete a full
search of the area and noted that she was directed to bring Youth
B back to the facility immediately. Staff 1 did not have line of sight
of Youth A when she left the area and or Youth B when they went
to the bathroom and Youth A went to the computer area while
Staff 1 was at the customer service area.
Technical Assistance:
8

- It is recommended the facility review with supervisors and
staff when to send staff or higher level to help support of
situation if off grounds and another youth needs to return
back to the facility, even if staff present are refusing
assistance.
- It is recommended the facility review the policy as it
pertains to the supervision requirements for when a youth
uses a restroom during an outing with both the team and
youth on the unit.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.

sir_summary.summary: A staff member took two youths to a public library. Following a conflict over seating, one youth went to the bathroom. The staff member, believing the youth had left the building, did not search the bathroom and, following a supervisor's instruction, departed with the second youth to return her to the facility, leaving the first youth unattended for 10-15 minutes. The staff member later returned with police and retrieved the youth. The investigation concluded the facility violated its own policies regarding line-of-sight supervision, diligent search for missing youths, and accompaniment to public restrooms. Primary culpability lies with Staff 1 for failing to supervise and search properly, but supervisory and policy communication failures also contributed.
